intro: Bertiera subsessilis var. congolana, commonly known as the Congo bertiera, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
